CatDescriptText: Ruetissus Williams, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you believe in corporal (paddling) punishment for students, in the elementary grades, who misbehave? If so, who should mete out the punishment-- the teacher or the principal?" answer reads: "Yes, in order for them to know that they should not do the wrong thing.  I think that the teachers should mete out the punishment."
TitMainTitle: Ruetissus Hawthorne wearing dark coat and holding handbag, standing in front of light colored stone flecked wall, store window with signs for Whitman's Chocolate and Wanted Waitress
